intro: Berkheya nivea, commonly known as the white berkheya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Berkheya nivea is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
